alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 6:20AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, west central Pocahontas, Nicholas, southeastern Braxton, Webster and central Fayette Counties through 645 AM EDT... At 619 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Webster Springs to near Powellton. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Fayetteville, Richwood, Rainelle, Babcock State Park, Webster Springs, Oak Hill, Ansted, Addison (Webster Springs), Camden-On-gauley, Hawks Nest State Park, Craigsville, Camden On Gauley, Powellton, Cowen, Meadow Bridge, Thurmond, Muddlety, Upper Glade and Boggs. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 12 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster
